entry.title: The Surrey and Sussex Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the Worthing and Southlands Hospitals National Health Service Trust, trust property held by the Surrey and Sussex Healthcare National Health Service Trust and makes related provision. A copy of the schedule of trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The Financial Assistance for Environmental Purposes (Scotland) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order varies section 153(1) of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 so as to enable the Scottish Ministers to give financial assistance to, or for the purposes of, the Waste Minimisation and Recycling Programme, the Carbon Trust and for any scheme for the regulation of emissions from motor vehicles.

entry.title: The Northern Birmingham Mental Health National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the Birmingham and Solihull Mental Health National Health Service Trust, trust property held by the Northern Birmingham Mental Health National Health Service Trust and makes related provision. A copy of the schedule of trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The South Birmingham Mental Health National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the Birmingham and Solihull Mental Health National Health Service Trust, trust property held by the South Birmingham Mental Health National Health Service Trust and makes related provision. A copy of the schedule of trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The Sea Fish (Specified Sea Areas) (Regulation of Nets and Other Fishing Gear) (Scotland) Amendment Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order amends the Sea Fish (Specified Sea Areas) (Regulation of Nets and Other Fishing Gear) (Scotland) Order 2000 as amended (S.S.I. 2000/227) (“the principal Order”). This Order like the principal Order is made pursuant to Article 46 of Council Regulation (EEC) No. 850/98 of 30th March 1998 for the conservation of fishery resources through technical measures for the protection of juveniles of marine organisms (O.J. No. L 125, 27.4.98, p.1). This Order forms part of the law of Scotland only.

entry.title: The Planning and Compensation Act 1991 (Amendment of Schedule 18) (Scotland) Order 2003
entry.summary: Part I of Schedule 18 to the Planning and Compensation Act 1991 specifies or describes the date from which interest is payable on compensation arising under the statutory provisions mentioned, which do not themselves provide for the payment of interest.

entry.title: The Social Security Benefits Up-rating Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations contain only provisions in consequence of an order under section 132 of the Social Security Administration (Northern Ireland) Act 1992 and accordingly, by virtue of section 149(3) of, and paragraph 3 of Schedule 5 to, that Act, are not subject to the requirement of section 149(2) of that Act for prior reference to the Social Security Advisory Committee.

entry.title: The Salisbury Health care National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the Avon and Wiltshire Mental Health Partnership National Health Service Trust, the West Hampshire National Health Service Trust, the New Forest Primary Care Trust, the Swindon and Marlborough National Health Service Trust and the Dorset Community National Health Service Trust trust property held by the Salisbury Health care National Health Service Trust and makes related provision. A copy of the schedules specifying the trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The Local Health Partnerships National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the Norfolk Mental Health Care National Health Service Trust, the James Paget Healthcare National Health Service Trust and the Norwich Primary Care Trust trust property held by the Local Health Partnerships National Health Service Trust and makes related provision. A copy of the schedules specifying the trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The Action Programme for Nitrate Vulnerable Zones (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The Action Programme for Nitrate Vulnerable Zones (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2003 is the published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer for Scotland. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Social Security (Maternity Allowance) (Earnings) (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Social Security (Maternity Allowance) (Earnings) Regulations 2000 (“the principal Regulations”) which provides for payments which are, or are to be treated as, earnings for the purpose of determining entitlement to maternity allowance under the Social Security Contributions and Benefits Act 1992.

entry.title: The Workmen’s Compensation (Supplementation) (Amendment) Scheme 2003
entry.summary: This Scheme amends the Workmen’s Compensation (Supplementation) Scheme 1982 by making adjustments to the rate of lesser incapacity allowance, such adjustments being consequential upon the increase in the maximum rate of that allowance made by the Social Security Benefits Up-rating Order 2003. The Scheme also makes transitional provision.

entry.title: The Private Hire Vehicles (London) (Transitional and Saving Provisions) Regulations 2003

category.term: METROPOLITAN AND CITY POLICE DISTRICTS;PRIVATE HIRE VEHICLES

entry.summary: These Regulations contain transitional provisions in connection with the introduction of private hire vehicle driver licensing under the Private Hire Vehicles (London) Act 1998 (“the 1998 Act”), the relevant provisions of which are brought into force by the Private Hire Vehicles (London) Act 1998 (Commencement No. 2) Order 2003 (S.I.) 2003/580 C.30).

entry.title: The Advice and Assistance (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2003
entry.summary: This version of the The Advice and Assistance (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2003 is the published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer for Scotland. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: Charges for Drugs and Appliances (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Charges for Drugs and Appliances Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1997 (“the principal Regulations”), which provide for the making and recovery of charges for drugs and appliances supplied by doctors and chemists providing pharmaceutical services, and by hospitals and HSS trusts to out-patients.

entry.title: The NHS Bodies and Local Authorities Partnership Arrangements (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the NHS Bodies and Local Authorities Partnership Arrangements Regulations 2001 (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Non-Domestic Rates (Levying) (Scotland) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision as to the amount payable in certain circumstances as non-domestic rates in respect of property in Scotland. They apply only to financial year 2003-2004 (“the relevant year”).

entry.title: The Products of Animal Origin (Third Country Imports) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations, which extend to Scotland only, amend the Products of Animal Origin (Third Country Imports) (Scotland) Regulations 2002 (S.S.I. 2002/445) (“the principal Regulations”) as follows:

entry.title: The Landfill Tax (Amendment) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations, which come into force on 1st April 2003, amend the Landfill Tax Regulations 1996 (S.I.1996/1527) (“the principal Regulations”) to provide a number of changes to the scheme whereby landfill site operators are entitled to credit based on the contributions they give to approved bodies with objects concerned with the environment. The details of this scheme are to be found in Part VII of the principal Regulations “ Credit: bodies concerned with the environment”.

entry.title: The Environmental Protection (Controls on Hexachloroethane) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply to England, Wales and Scotland, give effect to Commission Directive 2001/91/EC which adapted to technical progress for the eighth time Annex I to Council Directive 76/769/EEC on the approximation of the laws, regulations and administrative provisions of the Member States relating to restrictions on the marketing and use of certain dangerous substances and preparations.
